intro: Duhamelia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered duhamelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas of forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
